32J7P9FEfnKQprYrx2Epbw.text: Great services!!! Small resturant but pretty busy.  I been to alot of pho shop, and their workers ususlly don't come back to see if everything is ok after dropping off food. I would come again. Would be awesome if I got a bit more pork with my vermicelli salad.

dDKOyCc_Z8Q7HzNuafLiRg.text: This is my to go spot for nem nuong rolls, com tam, and bun bo hue. What I like about the nem nuong is that it tastes really fresh with just the lettuce, meat, and that crunchy thing in there. They don't add any other fillers to make the roll thicker like some other places. The bun bo hue was really tasty but I would've liked it spicier. Not sure if they had spice on the side you can add in. The com tam [broken rice] is another favorite as well. The portions are decent in size and fills me up. I've also ordered pho togo one day from this place and they give you a lot! The cut of meat was thin and tender and broth tasted very clean. I recommend all my friends here for Vietnamese food. They do have a long wait time for food to come out though, so be prepared for that.

eDVGv5HPDN-ezy9essE1KA.text: What does a man call for after a long night of drinking?  PHO!  Took to my handy Yelp app and found Pho Bosa.  It's probably one of the better Pho joint near the strip.  However, not by CA standard.  Of course, since we are in NV I have to say it's was pretty good.  A little weak on the broth, first time I had to add fish sauce to my broth.  The meat wasn't the best quality, but there was a lot of it.  It was also the first time I found my noodles to be undercooked.  I love that they did not skimp on the herbs.  Overall, a nice place to get a decent bowl of pho if you're in the area.

ZIHdIheWCtb2FQZBOOftQg.text: After a night of binge drinking me and my friends were craving a big ole bowl of pho. We went to yelp and found Pho bosa. Seeing that it has high reviews , we decided to try it out.   It's a small restaurant so it's definitely not good for big groups.   My whole table of 5 people ordered all pho and one bun rieu. We waited for about 15-25 mins to get our food. We were all pretty pissed that we had to wait so long for a bowl of pho. That's not even the worst part. The broth was bland and the noodles were hard. Then when the bill came out it just didn't add up. It was expensive..   Will not be coming back in the future.

MGXFOwNY74CmDtWL93SGDQ.text: PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS RIPPED OFF PHO BOSA RESTAURANT - They charged you 15% for what they called 'Service Charge' for 5 people or more.  It's fine for the 15% or even 18% like most American restaurants (Lucille's BBQ, Olive Garden, etc.) would charge.  But, the owner of this restaurant didn't get it through his head the BIG difference between those 15% American restaurants' service charge vs. the culturally basic Vietnamese restaurants' service charge.  We had to wait another additional 30 mins after we ordered our food.  After they brought out our food n drinks, they NEVER came by to ask or check on us.  They never came by n refilled our waters.  That was it, they delivered everything to our table ONCE.  After that they charged us (without any warning or notification) the 15% on our bill n until we asked, that was when they mentioned about their ripped-off n unethical 'Service Charge'.  We will NEVER come back here again.  They give most Vietnamese restaurants the BAD names.  SHAME ON YOU PHO BOSA !!!

DXJwBRf30g-qFvN5MYcRbg.text: First of all we had the worse service. It took them about 20 minutes to bring us our water. When the lady finally did my cup was dirty. The pho was okay. 7I_3ZS6rTVYL2aTk53DXGA.text: Came here when I visited Vegas this past weekend & it was pretty good. I think all of their pho bowls are large only. I got the pho tai & it was delicious. Broth was very flavorful.   I also got the pork spring roll & that was so good as well. I love the crunchy fried wonton stick they have inside.   The restaurant is very small though with a limited amount of seatings as compared to other pho restaurants. I wouldn't mind coming here again the next time I'm in town.

o00dPxMtDZwhBjVLlAEB3A.text: Last year, a sad day had fallen upon the Las Vegas community when word of Bosa 1, the amazing Vietnamese restaurant, would be closing its doors. To many peoples, including myself, this restaurant opened my eyes to the "other" world of Vietnamese cuisine... one which did not include pho. Here was the first time I had tried broken rice, bbq, and stir fried noodle dishes, that I have since tried at many other restaurants, but have not seen executed to the same high standard. What I missed most about Bosa 1 was that they did make, without a doubt, the best Bun Bo Hue in the Valley.  I was ecstatic to hear that the owner's were opening a new restaurant in Las Vegas called Pho Bosa, which would carry all of the items that Bosa 1 carried, as well as pho. Having procrastinated enough (they have been open for several months), I decided to check out the new location.  Pho Bosa is located on the intersection of Spring Mountain and Polaris. It is right next door to the 702 bar (for now anyways.. that bar has also been the Bikini Bar, and previously before that, the Sand Dollar Blues Lounge) There is plenty of parking, and you really can't miss the sign. After coming in, I was seated immediately by the hospitable host/server. After quickly looking over the menu, I knew exactly what I wanted. It was the dish I was missing the most.. Bun. Bo. Hue. I got a fried egg roll for an extra 1.50. After receiving my water and little side dish of thai basil, bean sprouts, and lime for my soup, my spring roll and soup was brought to me shortly thereafter.   Egg Roll - crispy wonton shell with pork and veggies on the inside. The flavors tasted really well balanced and the shell wasn't too greasy. A little bit small, but tasted good.  Bun Bo Hue - For many of you who have never eaten anything but pho, and really want to try some of the other dishes of Vietnam (and have a liking for spicy foods), I really urge you to try Bun Bo Hue. At Pho Bosa, they make it really well. You can taste the ginger, lemongrass and shrimp in the broth. The chili oil that is mixed in the broth gives it a nice kick! The noodles are more thicker and rounder than ones you see in pho. The beef was tender, and so were the pig's knuckles. Don't be too put off by the congealed pigs blood. It doesn't have a metallic taste you find in beef blood, and IMO, the flavor was very neutral, almost like a tofu. One knock, I wish the broth could have been saltier (but maybe that's because i've been eating a lot ramen in the past year.. it has increased my sodium resistance).  Can't wait to come back and try their broken rice, and grilled specialties. I'm also curious to try their pho, and see how it stacks up against other pho places. The service here was also good.

YACY7ZH5i7HzhrumdM7m9A.text: Food is good but the wait is too long, takes forever to get the food and the staff is unfriendly. The person who took our order sounded almost angry. Being charged for every little thing we asked for (e.g. A bit of extra onion for pho), regardless of the final amount, all in all it was not a pleasant dining experience.. I probably won't be back.

ZJeLORRMOUzs_CHrMC5yQw.text: "Dude, you stink.  No time for a shower?" says my Mid West, non Asian poker bud as he gets into the car.  "What the?!?" I take personal hygiene seriously unlike the average poker player.  "Yeah, you smell like an Asian; 'lemongrassy'." he continues and laughs.  "You can get out and walk you know".  OK so it was True that I just finished one of Pho Bosa's  delicious specialties, Bun Bo Hue, a spicy bowl of collagen laced, beef, lemongrass noodle soup with ginger infused pork blood cake, melting beef tendons, well braised shank, topped with  raw onions, unusual herbs, and the zing of lime.  The perfect balance of sweet, sour, savory, spicy.  Not to be overshadowed, the Bun Rieu (Shrimp and crab soup with vermicelli rice noodles).  Complex flavors from fermented fish sauce, a concentrated chicken broth and shrimp stock,  acidic kick of tomatoes, vibrancy from cilantro, bitterness of green onions and fried tofu for body.  It's just good eats.  Com Tam (broken rice) plates are interesting.  Remember, this is Southeast Asian cooking, everything is overcooked by American standards.  Choose the sides (good egg roll, rubbery quiche and shrimp cake) and a meat (deeply marinated Korean style short ribs, dry pork chop, thin slices of soft beef, flavorful grilled chicken).  Done.  The rice itself is different texturally thanks to smaller grains cooking faster than unbroken grains and starch being released throughout.  Definitely worth a try.  Finally the pho.  A powerhouse of heavily extracted beef flavor and spices.  Heavy mouth feel.  Excellent.  Typical Asian service (you know what I mean).  Reasonable prices.

QxqcfmR9y3MpjTggdUSeuA.text: We both had oxtail pho & added broccoli & bok choi.  It was phenomenal as was the service.

kX_3VF7bBMALuTOOPNjEew.text: I used to go to Pho Kim Long, however this time I was too hungry to wait for seating. Pho Bosa is legit good. I would say it's even better than Pho Kim Long. There's no wait, food comes out quickly, and the servers are friendly. I will be back!

nk23Gnv0KWtLNPyN3bwcXg.text: Came here over the weekend for lunch by myself. Off strip food in Vegas is always more affordable and delicious! I was seated promptly by friendly servers, ordered pho dac biet (combo pho) and nem nuong rolls. The food comes out pretty quick and they bring out napkins and utensils. The rolls were good, and the wontons were crispy inside the rolls. The pho was flavorful and the meat quality was good! My bowl of pho was on point and one of the better phos I've had off strip. I like that the brisket looks like brisket and not some dried out fatty piece of meat. Overall good food and friendly service and closer from the strip. I will be back!

MyeFixXCDZd0K1SGkox1eQ.text: I would give this place 3.5 stars, but I can only put like 3 or 4 stars, so 3 stars sounds about right. It is really reasonable price, usually pho is like $9 and higher. I got the pho special combination for like $8.25 and I checked in Yelp for a $1 off for a green Thai Tea. The pho is good, noodles and meat options are decent, but my girlfriend, she noticed the soup does tasted a little more oily and greasy than normal. I noticed that too. I got a large bowl, but it looks like a normal size pho. Not that special. But the green Thai tea I got was delightful. It had a different taste to it. It's like the green milk tea I usually order at any Banh Mi Che Cali restaurants in California and this has the same similarities, but different ingredients and similar type of taste appeal they are trying to grab the customers taste buds to it. I think they have their own Bosa cafe where they specializes their own boba drinks. Next time, I should come by the morning and getting their pho, like seafood, because everything does tastes a lot better in the morning or in the late night after you had too many drinks.

oNPMOTBYcxOibY6ZrREyKQ.text: after a long night of partying, what better way to cure your hangover symptoms than a huge bowl of pho?  this place gives you the biggest bang for your buck, especially in vegas. it's located off the strip, (and it's a little difficult to find) so prices are so much better than if you were to eat closer to town. i paid $9 for a large (they only offer one size) and i didn't even finish my food. you're definitely not going to find that on the strip.  their cococane is a combination of sugarcane and coconut juice, two drinks that vietnamese people are known for, and it definitely didn't disappoint. it's $9, but they give you this huge cup with so many coconut shavings! it's great for the ride home, until you have to use the bathroom cuz you were drinking so much of it (LOL)!  I'm definitely coming here before every ride home. and the name is so punny!

SlinzJFFoIg6Vbws1YG0ig.text: Long overdue review for Pho Bosa. I have been coming here since they were in the Jones location, so over 8-10 years ago?. The consistency has not let me down ever since. It is definitely my friends and my go to pho place in town.   The current location is their biggest location so far. I've gone on weeknights that there were only couple tables, and weekends that's packed with tables and the lines were out of the door.   Service is decent and fast. It's a place you eat and leave.   Here's the items that I usually order:  1. Nem nuong cuon (5/5): it's a spring roll with pork sausage. I enjoy this from Brodard in OC a lot. And Bosa's is really comparable to Brodard. This is my must get item. All my friends and family love it too.   2. Bun bo hue (5/5): my go to pho. This is a spicy Vietnamese beef noodle soup. I enjoy the flavor a lot but I wish it can be more spicy. Ask for their hot sauce in the back.   3. Bun rieu (4/5): when I don't feel like eating beef, I would get this crap noodle soup. It's a tomato base soup with tofu that's on the lighter side.   I also tried various grilled meat with broken rice dishes and regular beef pho. They were pretty good as well.   No one else in town can compare to Pho Bosa on their signature dishes. They definitely are worth checking it out.

Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue (5/5)
Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slice thin beef with egg, egg rolls and shredded pork (3/5)

deWw8wDBV3INC5llvM55qg.text: I loved the Bun Bo Hue.  The owner was perfect with the service. I grew up near Garden Grove, CA and have eaten lots of Vietnamese food. This place is a treat. Reasonable prices.  Toi yeu Bun bo Hu. Cac ch s hu la hoan ho vi cac dch v. Toi ln len gn Garden Grove, CA va a an rt nhiu mon an Vit Nam. Ni nay la mt iu tr. Gia c hp ly.

d0d-DrU3jp34NizHrQ7jXQ.text: Vegas is a town filled with entertainment, excitement, and ample exquisite restaurants with everyone in mind.  Many fine dining from famous chefs to home cooked meals from the locals within Uber rides away.    The last stop before heading home, we decided to have something light and soothing.  Pho Bosa seemed to fit our needs and recommended from many yelpers.  Our orders were chef's special - Smokey ox tail pho, bun bo hue, and fried egg roll.  Order came in rather slower than the typical Vietnamese restaurant.   Egg roll is nothing outstanding.  The ox tail is the star of the day.  Broth is very clear and has many earthy flavors of onion, cloves, and lime,   The infused Smokey favors aromatic is unbelievable that it smelled as it had just been infused from the Smokey gun directly delivered to the table from the kitchen.  Ox tail is tender and meaty.  It had big three pieces in the bowl, but it is enough meat for one serving.    The bun bo hue is ok, typical favors of spicy beef broth with a hint of tomato to enhance your appetizer, however, I prefer the bolder heat.  Great recommendations.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail pho and spicy beef noodles
Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried egg rolls

2za_aIwHDHXacZWSH8otpA.text: To begin, I'd actually would rate this a 4.5 stars. Everything was very tasty except for the Bun bo hue and the fried egg rolls.   They have these chef special ox tail pho that we ordered and it was very tasty and rich in flavor. To my taste, it was a tad bit more on the sweet side. The portion was humongous though! Considering it's $17.99 for the ox tail, lololol.    Their spring rolls were made with spam and they have the fried wonton skins inside as well to make it crunchy.   The pork blood in the bun bo hue was sweet... I do not like. The broth tasted alright, thought it could be richer.   They also offer a wide selection of beverages and I've tried the sugarcane coconut, which was an odd combination that tasted good.   Service was nice and the restaurant is pretty spacious.

r2ntOLxbIXV7mmOl1MM4Gg.text: I got the Smokey short rib pho and it was bomb. The broth was really rich in flavor. Only negative I can think of is that they don't have all the condiments that I'm use to adding in my pho, such as soy sauce, chili oil peppers, sugar and crush roasted peanuts. Other than that, this place is great. They greet you and is attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smokey short rib pho
Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls

XjK7w_Ufq9zipSVjHE-u-A.text: Wonderful service by Moe and his friendly staff, as always. This place is usually busy, but their service remains timely, professional and courteous.   We usually order the crab soup #78 or the regular pho. Today we tried the tofu spring rolls and the vermicelli with pork. Everything was delicious!   If you're looking for a vietnamese restaurant for delicious pho after a night of drinking or simply want a place for family and friends to enjoy a great meal, this is the place to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #77 very flavorful and spicy!

KwQeAF9INbIdHNHASXtWlw.text: In regards to my previous bad review, my family and I decided to give Pho Bosa a shot. We have been here many times already and for different occasions!  This little gem hidden in Chinatown is my MUST GO TO place for some bomb Bu Bo Hue!!! I also love that they offer fresh sugarcane juice. Definitely try their pork spring rolls. The service is really positive, attentive, and worthwhile!!!

nf2JvWahjRyUuGzVqnaUuA.text: We stopped by Pho Bosa for a quick bite before our trip back home to California. I usually go to Pho Kim Long but I knew there would be a 30 minutes wait so we went here instead.  We got here at 10:50 am and there a few party there already. We got sat down pretty quickly and were provided menus and water immediately.  We order the two pho special, two nem cuon ( pork sausage spring rolls) and the nem nuong vermicelli. First thing you do is taste the pho soup before adding the condiments. You can taste if the broth is authentic or from powder. Luckily for us, it was authentic! The nem cuon was surprisingly good and refreshing on a typical hot summer morning in Vegas. I had the nem nuong vermicelli as my entree. As you can tell, I like nem a lot. I didn't feel like having pho on a hot day.  The service was okay. The waiter gave me attitude when I asked him to reseal my green Thai milk tea because I spilled some content trying to mix it. The green Thai milk tea tasted like pandan so it's different from the traditional Thai milk tea some are use to.   I did like that the portion here was pretty big and they didn't skimp out on the protein!

NoFSrsmzmSdXmbsNC_IDYg.text: This was my second time eating here. It's a popular place amongst my crew after a weekend visit to Vegas.   The service is great, food is traditionally Vietnamese (except for the panini sandwiches, but hey you can order them), and the portions are appropriate.   I've had the pho, the broken rice dishes, and the spring rolls. I wouldn't pass off on having any of those. I don't think you can go wrong here with what your going to order.

We drive by everyday on our way to work & always noticed it's always busy. So, we decided to finally give it a try. The food was excellent, flavors were on point. ae4m63ECVNHvWJDlc4qThA.text: Let me explain the 4-stars. The food was top notch here. I'm not exactly sure what sorcery of spices they have in this kitchen but that was the best broth I have ever tasted in my life. Definitely top 5 best pho I've ever had. I took a star away for 1.the wait (about 30mins to be sat and 15mins for food to table), 2.the staff not explaining the process of waiting, 3.the smallest waiting area ever -- so really it's nothing about the food but just the beginning of the experience. That said it was worth the wait and worth the confusion about seating. FYI: write your name on the list (if there is a wait) and the total amount of guest. No need to wait for staff to write your name and tell you how long; they'll say they don't know lol

lQToLYNVl2CTZx8mK3kFag.text: The portion sizes here are huge.  The combination pho was very flavorful and delicious.  Pork spring roll was awesome.  Their dipping sauce was perfect.  I would definitely come back here again.

PK-MxgEcy1s0a3LTB8952g.text: Craving pho in vegas come here! Super tasty, nice and hot, good amount of pho and meat. I swear everytime i thought i was portioning out the meat to noodles i found more meat which was a nice surprise! Had to eat this quick because we had somewhere to be so the service wasn't super fast but it was a bit crowded. So worth the price split it with my friend couldn't eaten a whole if we wanted to/had more time though.   Didn't like vietnamese roll the sausage or whatever meat it was was weird, not your typical roll from when i've ordered it at other places before. The fried spring roll was super good though nice and crunchy and good filling. Perfect with fish oil and lettuce and there were like 6-8 or something?! In comparison to 2 vietnamese rolls cut in half (clear skin i thought that was called the summer roll maybe?)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ckxxTKxDJVhdeCN8uqNptA.text: I am pretty sure this is one of the best, if not the best, Vietnamese places in town. Everything is so well prepared, flavorful, and prompt service. Also, while this place was poppin on a Sunday afternoon, me and my boyfriend got seated pretty quickly because their turnaround was so fast. This is the type of place that you - for lack of better description - come to eat. It's not fancy, but this is a foodie spot for sure. Anyway, enough of the background story--more into the food.   I got the combination pho, pork sausage Vietnamese rolls, and a mango/pineapple basil seed drink   1) pho: best pho I have had -- counting places in Michigan. I'm sorry I'm not Vietnamese so I can't speak to any mother's at home cooking, but for restaurants in Vegas this is easily one of the best. The broth is so beefy and rich, and had the perfect amount of onion vs anise ratio. Also, this is the best beef ball I've had in pho. Seriously-- it's so juicy and flavorful.   2) pork sausage spring rolls - AHHHmazing (sorry if that expression is from 2007). But these were super fresh, the sausage was juicy and tasty as well, plus they put a bit of the wrapper from the fried egg roll in it too. Their 13? 14? Spice peanut sauce is super good too. Together, these created the perfect bite! Texture wise and taste wise too, v cohesive  3) my drank - a bit too sweet for my liking, but again very good textures! The chewiness of the basil + bits of fruit were so good. Very refreshing for the Vegas heat, although I had this in the midst of the windy "winter"   All in all, it was an awesome experience that I will be sharing for generations to come. It is kind of in an unannounced spot on Twain and valley view, but adds to its genuinity. Thank you Bosa!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rHHWgCCQRDV594NqqehPcQ.text: Pho Bosa is a small mom & pop Pho restaurant that has been consistently good throughout my visits...I'm a fan..  Bosa service:  Every visit we've been seated immediately which is one of the main reasons I frequent here.  The kitchen gets the dishes out quickly and keeps the drinks fresh as well.  Drinks are self serve which I prefer at smaller mom and pop restaurants.  Bosa Grindage:  All the Pho bowls I've consumed consistently have had flavorful broth and noodles.  The Pho with oxtail was a special which I hope makes it to the menu permanently.  I always appetize up with the the Pork Fresh Rolls, super yummy.  The rice plates come loaded with: rice, egg rolls, egg cake plus whatever meat/protein you selected.  The dining area is super casual as all mom and pop joints area and it's clean and there's plenty of seating for a small restaurant which makes for consistent immediate seating.  The menu is extensive with lots of Pho bowls and dishes to sample for a great price.  This will bring me back for more visits but that's another Yelp tale.  Enjoy! =)

bwVjXNmIUQc0AHGKyCUI0Q.text: A conveniently located Pho spot located in Vegas Chinatown. Service was good, they brought the food out quickly and it was fairly priced. Can't really mess up pho, it wasn't anything spectacular but it wasn't bad either. It was a good choice for a hangover!

E1afnttkzZcbDbs0f8KREw.text: Great BUN BO HUE for Vegas during the Winter months. Summer months, opt for the COM Tam bi cha thit nuong, meat is grilled to perfection, even better than Little Saigon in OC and I am from the OC area. Best Asian place in Vegas!! So glad they move to this bigger place, million times BETTER than Kim Long for pho, bun, com, everything but too bad they don't open 24hrs otherwise they would put Kim Long out of business. Soups are perfectedLy flavored, rice portions are HUGE. We always end our Vegas trip by stopping here before heading back to OC. I took Our group of 12 here today & everyone loved it. excellent service too:) Will definitely come back anytime we are in Vegas!!

u0A6kyIJCN3AoQGwIc4ryA.text: I love these guys I go to every location they've had up till this one. No one makes better rice dishes omg, literally no one unless I'm in Cali or in VN

MXX3SgJzVmu2TZwN_pv2bg.text: This place deserves one star because they have fresh sugar cane drinks here. That's it.   The pictures on yelp and the pho outside is very misleading. We asked for nuoc beo. They don't have it. That shows me their pho isn't slowed cooked.   I ordered a special order. The lady wanted to charge me more to put the meat separately. She kept questioning me on why.   I ordered tofu spring rolls. Came to find out it was pork with tofu.   These place lacks communication. The pho lacks flavor. We re still ok a quest to find good pho in Vegas.

F69gJTPeqa8Q_1POUW3K1w.text: As a former Californian, I was devastated after moving to Las Vegas. The Vietnamese food scene here is lackluster (but slowly improving). Luckily, I was quickly introduced to Bosa 1 for their amazing rice plates. Not long thereafter, I fell in love with their fantastic bun bo hue and bun rieu...just like my mom used to make!! The portions are generous, the ingredients fresh and of superb quality. You can taste the homemade goodness in everything -- from the perfectly-cooked broken rice to the moist egg quiche to the amazing lemongrass bun bo hue broth. I used to eat at the old location at least 2-3 times a week. And during their several-month hiatus/relocation, I was like a druggie on withdrawal. I *craved* a good rice plate, and I must've visited every single Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas to get my fix. But alas, I was met with disappointment EVERY SINGLE TIME. Needless to say, I was ecstatic when Pho Bosa reopened; it was like my dealer had teased me so I would want more, and I've definitely been back many times to reclaim that euphoria. I work as a VIP concierge at a large upscale resort/casino on the Strip, and I'm often asked where to get pho/Vietnamese food. You can be sure I never send them to the TI(t)!! Every guest that had taken my advice has come back raving about the wonderful food, service and prices. Bosa 1/Pho Bosa is the best Vietnamese food in Las Vegas, hands down! But don't just take my word for it; check out what these other local media outlets have to say: lasvegasweekly.com/news/... eatinglv.com/2009/08/bos... lasvegasweekly.com/news/... With their new location comes extended open hours, credit card payments and a slightly larger dining area. The staff is still just as friendly and accommodating. Do note that they are closed on Wednesdays. If you're a lucky local or just a Vegas visitor, do not miss the chance to enjoy the great offerings at this humble but wonderful restaurant. _________________________________________ And in response to Sandra C. from Encino, CA: Honey, if you actually read the reviews like you claim you did, you'll notice that this is the reincarnation of their first store, Bosa 1. yelp.com/biz/bosa-1-las-... How about you check out their nearly-100 high-ranked reviews there before making yourself look like an idiot. And another thing, I've worked at several businesses (large and small) where they use ipads for signing. Most people are STUPID and use their fingernails REGARDLESS of how much you emphasize to use their actual fingers. With your attitude, your bad experience must've been of your own making anyway. I feel sorry for you; it must be impossible to ever make you happy. Perhaps you should just go rejoin all the hipsters at Pho Kim Long, as that seems to be more your scene.

Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heaven in a bowl: bun bo hue!
Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Bosa/Bosa 1 broken rice plate

QaFtsL6JrMiU16trf32VTw.text: The food is horrible and they charge you a arm and leg, check the bill before you pay!!!!!!

bNbeozYOdLHCfc9GfsrjSQ.text: Got straight beef pho with spring roles and it really hit the spot. Cheap, no complaints. worth going off the strip for.

Nf97YOMXnZ5uabl0LFn5zQ.text: The pho was very delicious! We ordered 5 bowls of pho and everyone was impressed by it. The broken rice dish was also yummy. Their grilled meat was very tender! Highly recommended.

NDHs8-i6lWj3npicea4gdA.text: I have never had such amazing service. Moises is so friendly and remembers you everytime you come back! The food is also wonderful and the meat in the pho is so delicious. If you're looking for great pho, you should definitely check this place out. Also their coffee is so delicious.

sSfOQ5djnLlzXMR-1X2C2A.text: I've been a big fan of Pho Bosa since they were called Bosa 1 back at their old location, and I am a fan because of they have consistently delicious food.  Apparently their fan base is growing and has followed them to the new location.  We went back about a week ago (to start off our wedding anniversary celebration) and it was cray cray in there!  We felt so bad because they didn't have enough staff to keep up with the demand!  One look at the staff - you could see that they were sweatin' bullets!  My point of this observation is that Pho Bosa usually has friendly service and consistent eats.    Our usual fav's: Bun Bo Hue Bun Rieu Nem Nuong Cuon! Cafe Sua Da  I heart Pho Bosa.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No Nuong rice plate

Jf6Jxy2CZ9CSyvL5pg4OQw.text: 9 of us came here on Sunday night.  Our waiter MO was super friendly and helpful.  He had suggested the pot stickers  and the crispy shrimp (which is like a lettuce wrap)  for appetizers and they both were great.  Then we of course  had a variety of their food choices. The  pho is excellent, I am picky with pho and never order it at a new place.  A few from our group did,  so of course I had to try it.  It was great, The broth was so full of flavor without even adding anything to it.  We tried there noodle and rice dishes as well and they were excellent.  I don't think this place has anything  I would not like.  Such a wonderful hidden gem to find with all the choices you have in vegas.  This is a must for every trip out here now.

CxvHwmyWR7JVdREqnord2g.text: We went to get a bowl of bun bo hue on our weekend in Vegas. On Saturday, they posted a sign saying that they ran out of food. On Sunday, after a 30 minute wait, we were seated only to find that they didn't have the bun bo hue available. The venue lacked air condition and we had a fly that pestered our table. Our server dropped off the food and then never made it back to our table... I normally don't leave reviews but this experience warranted a review.

O95sBpPo1d6u8OTV12jlXA.text: The outside of this place looked like it the food was going to taste like crap.  The outside of the building was such a turnoff that I wanted to leave.  What made me change my mind was the reviews and ratings.  I am glad we didn't leave.  My friends and I ordered #72-74.  Our pho bowls were all pretty similar.  They consisted of rare steak, fish balls, and other meats.  Every dish was really really good.  I was amazed.  The bowls were huge too.  Large sized.  There was so much noodles in our bowls.  We ate until we were suffed to the max.    You can also tell if a place is good if the place is packed and there's a waiting list.  This place had both!  Totally wasn't not a disappointment.

QUq74cc3NDByVc3LXR9BYg.text: I had a nice Bon Rieu shrimp noodle soup!!! And my friends got beef rice noodle soups that are tasty too!!! Three of us got a bill of $28.10 only...Nice hideout place that we'll definitely come back regularly!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp rice noodle soup

7qCP_G9rpSP9r_s88rLSfA.text: We stopped in here to get our fix for our phone craving. It wasn't our first pick, the other place had a long wait. Overall, this place is slightly hidden. Service is typical for a Asian business. Waitress was an old lady that was ready to take our order, two minutes after we sat down.   The pho was pretty good. The broth was flavorful, lots of meat, and good amount of noodles.

KXCsXE9vRYiy_hhNLjWWaQ.text: I've been here a handful of times, but haven't left a review yet. The staff is friendly and their pho never disappoints. Pho Ga is usually my first pick. Their egg rolls (chicken or pork) are so crispy & flavorful. And the Vietnamese coffee (iced or hot) is good. They're coming out with new desserts one of which we got to sample tonight, which was their tiramisu and it was delicious! Definitely ordering that on our next visit.

pKtlvv9xW9TSJ-12XUTbzw.text: Finally!  We were able to try the food at Pho Bosa..well, at least this location.  I ordered the Bun Bo Hue and Earl ordered the vermicelli with the eggroll, shrimp cake, and pork patty.  The Bun Bo Hue was nice and spicy.  What I enjoy the most about Bun Bo Hue is the tender pork hocks.  Although there were only two small pieces, they were tender.  However, the flavor of the bun bo hue did not come through.  They were tasteless pieces of pork hocks.  I have to make sure I have spoonfuls of the soup before I eat the pork hocks. Otherwise, the soup is fragrant and delicious.  I tried Earl's food and there were tons of flavor in his bowl of yum yum stuff.   The eggroll was nice and crispy, the shrimpcake was tasty, and nem nuong (pork patty) was perfect.  We made our mixture of dipping sauce and put tons of sambal and voila!  I will order this next time!  We will definitely return.

uSpLnA-9Agm3e3vhJpp3Yg.text: Mission: Escape the food halls and overpriced Vegas hotel restaurants. Objective: Find real food, cure hangover.  A quick look on Yelp we were able to find Pho Bosa. Located in a crappy looking strip mall without much signage, but quickly realized we had discovered a hidden gem. The pho broth was amazing. Authentic, beefy goodness, that satisfied our objective immediately.   Very affordable, great service (kind enough to call us a cab and allow us to sit inside while waiting to escape the heat-- despite our many items of baggage clogging up their narrow front doorway!), great product. Highly recommend.

C-BrlJWpbSa-l4cILvl33w.text: Pho Bosa definitely fits the description of "hole in the wall" kind of joint, because the restaurant interior is small and feel constricted. The furniture look like they were bought from garage sale or flea market and the building looks kind of run-down. The look might scare some potential customer away.   HOWEVER, once you tried their specialty "Bun Bo Hue", you will want to come back for more. I've lived in Vegas for 9 years and this place (on the average) still has the best Bun Bo Hue in town. Their other specialty is broken rice dishes (com tam), which is good but not exceptional. Their Pho is okay too, not bad.  Lately, I noticed food came out much faster than before. I believe they might have more staff in the kitchen and therefore reduced the time it takes for food to come out.   FYI, they close on Wednesday and sometimes on other days too, so if you live far from this place, it's best to call ahead to make sure they open that day.

9J-63vM8v5OUXQB_KUiQtw.text: This place is heaven. The pho is really good for a cheap price and the service is 20/10.

nbnQ-Ig4NfslSojPqYLGtA.text: Holy crap, 50 minutes and our food still hasn't come. Slowest cook and prep time I've ever experienced for a pho restaurant. Food is also mediocre and the pork spring roll is meh compared to Brodard. Yelp reviews mislead customers like us... Don't come.

f845MFcYbH5Bj7FdCUMVQg.text: It was ok, nothing too special, they didnt have spring rolls with shrimp so that didnt make me happy, the steak pho was ok, best I can say about the place.

_w8VmK7lQJ1m3ysYPuKwcA.text: Pho Bosa is Amazing!  Fam and I were looking for something different and this was perfection.  First off we are vegan/vegetarian so we had quite a few questions about their menu. Service was excellent!  Our waiter, Moses was very knowledgeable and very accommodating. He thought of everything!    The food was just as good if not better! Super fresh and fortifying! Simply Delicious!

IHu-9wJHXYyL6gTXFhT4pQ.text: Absolutely the worse Vietnamese place I've ever been at. The pho is acceptable. The pork chop is frozen dried jerky that is over brined and salted. The pork spring roll is not freshly made.

5fTsjUJW-O9q9QSvY8tRFA.text: Best Pho we've had! Big portions great price. Spring rolls were so yummy with the pork sausage. Plenty of parking and lots of seating. Food came out so quick and this place had great service!

TZrW8cNFUjO0OW2Z-W8l9A.text: This was my first time here at Pho Bosa. I have heard a lot about this place from my friends specially about their Bun Bo Hue. It was so good. I haven't eaten a good hot spicy beef soup ( bun bo hue) in vegas. The broth is perfect, not too oily or salty. Highly recommend this place.

lRx4jACWY8cxZCxSlRY5fw.text: We came here as a last hurrah from an extravagant bachelor party.  We ordered the smoked oxtail pho and it was amazing.  The broth had tremendous flavor with mints of smokiness.  The oxtail was fall of bone tender.  A bit expensive but would definitely come back here again.

qeE064aVyqqmVxq5gXeq6g.text: The pho tai I had was amazing loved that their soup was freshly prepared and the broth was my favorite part about the dish. After dinner tried out the Vietnamese coffee and it was so freaking good. Definitely coming back for more and the owners were so friendly and really proud of their food!!

Xk7WW3wMZC95YhLSpLZiVg.text: After a long weekend in Vegas, my husband wanted to grab some good Pho before heading home. So we do what we usually do and yelp a place. Pho Bosa popped up with a decent amount of reviews, both mixed with 5 stars and 1/2's.   I'm always the type of person to try a place even though it has a couple of OK reviews, just for my own opinion.  Presentation: Small little mom and pop joint. Not the nicest place but, this is what I imagine what mom and pop stops look like.  Wait: We were seated immediately. It took us about 5-10 minutes to look at the menu before we ordered.  Customer Service: The customer service deserves a 5 Star. The waiter was fast with water refills, persistent, and did his job well.   Food: I was a little disappointed in their Pho Dac Biet. Which is the original pho that comes with tendon, brisket, meatballs, meat etc., you know.. the usual. The meat was tough, and the texture was over cooked, the broth was.. just not good. The best part of it was the meatballs. My husband ordered one as well with some spring rolls and let me tell you, those were DELICIOUS. I'll definitely come back for those, and probably try something new!  Overall: I wouldn't get the Pho, But I would definitely come back for the spring rolls and willing to try a new soup!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food stop before we head out

ViBt3TI1fMmKYRAlWl7NlA.text: We ordered a few pho and bun bo hui and a drink . They were all very good. Lots of meat in the pho.

OKN_UB9ZYWXWw6LZfKaGWQ.text: Bad service and demanded 15% tip for nothing. Was force to sit on 4 people table for 5 adults even half of the place was empty. Food was terrible.

bgWwp0j2a3pmejgiJqNk2g.text: I've tried about 10 diff Vietnamese places in Vegas now and Pho Bosa is easily the best overall. The best pho and vermicelli & rice bowls! 0V2iLP_zlwHhP94PxflMHw.text: My family and I were in the area visiting The Orleans for a Arts and Crafts show. We were hungry afterwards and saw rave reviews of Pho Bosa on Yelp. We decided to eat at Pho Bosa for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. Pho Bosa is a Vietnamese Kitchen located in Las Vegas, Nevada. It's located between Twain and Spring Valley. It's located in a small parking lot and has private parking available. Opening hours are as follows, based on phobosakitchen.com: MONDAY10:00 am to 9:30 pm TUESDAY10:00 am to 9:30 pm WEDNESDAY closed THURSDAY10:00 am to 9:30 pm FRIDAY10:00 am to 9:30 pm SATURDAY10:00 am to 9:30 pm SUNDAY10:00 am to 9:30 pm Pho Bosa also offers fresh sugar cane and fresh coconut. We entered and were immediately greeted by the host. There was plenty of seating available, so we selected a booth towards the front of the restaurant. Menus were provided and drinks were requested from our waiter. We asked for a Boba Tea, 2 waters, and a soda. Afterwards, my family and I ordered the following [1] Rice w/ Chicken [Combo that came with egg roll and various other sides] [1] Panini with chicken, pesto, and tomato The meals came out relatively quickly and the waiter was quite attentive to our table. We often had our drinks refilled numerous times. The food was hot when it came out. The rice was soft, not overcooked and flavorful, especially with the grilled chicken on-top. The grilled chicken tasted good, with a nice BBQ style marinade. It wasn't burnt, or under-cooked. The Panini was good. There was a gracious amount of chicken inside along with the tomatoes. The bread tasted like it had been baked in the morning at the restaurant. The service is awesome at this place! If I am in the area again, I'll have to stop by Pho Bosa one more time!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cQOegv5UW0tMjAtR1k55Iw.text: Best Pho ever! And I'm from Alhambra CA, 2nd China Town next to downtown Chinatown. Not only homely ambience, service staff is fantastic... my kids and I started off with coconut milk tea, honeydew smoothie, regular milk tea and another smoothie I can't remember the name of... well worth the price for their over sized LARGE cups and so flavorful! My coconut milk tea was the absolute bomb!   Then came our orders.... meatball pho, shrimp pho and 2 orders of spring rolls... their service was so personable as they came back to our tables many times even having conversations with my kids... one of my kids said "this is the best restaurant ever".... going back to their pho broth.... the story is... 8 years ago when they first started, it tasted like sh*t, but they didn't give up until they reached the broth they have today.... very rich and smooth.... very clean flavor. And the bowls are large size! I couldn't finish it... Again... I'm from Alhambra and I've eaten pho at many many restaurants.... theirs is the best I've had.   Their spring rolls are larger than I'm used to, filled with pork sausage and lots of fresh vegetables with killer peanut sauce (still warm)  that they serve with tiny little spoons so we don't make mess everywhere.... it's the details!!    The best part? The sample of their chef's oxtail special! Broth was so deep and cleeeeeean.... even my kids' verbal expressions with taste of 1 spoonful of their broth and 1 piece of oxtail were "oh my God... we're coming back..."  And we are....  Update.... we came back 3 nights straight.... my kids didn't want to eat anywhere else... next year this is their first stop....

uaCmZTEGkmqikKSZRM-FcA.text: We saw the good reviews on Yelp so decided to try this place out. When we first walked through the door, not a single staff greeted us. They all just looked at us like we did not belong there. I proceeded to ask if we should seat ourselves and finally one of the staff told us to wait for a table to be setup. I looked around and there were several tables open with only a few occupied by other customers...We then waited almost an hour to order and finally get our food!  We came mainly for the spring rolls and was super disappointed. The sauce was terrible, and the spring rolls tasted nothing like the ones we got in Cali. Not sure what people were raving about. The bun bo hue was decent. The com tam rice dishes were good but did not come with any dipping sauce. They had some clear watered down fish sauce at the table that tasted more like vinegar.  We were also charged automatic gratuity at the end since we had a party of 5 or more (4 adults and 2 kids under 4). That may explain the lack of customer service. Please note that they don't provide receipts so if you want one, you would have to give them your email address so they could email it to you!   Overall, it was a negative experience for us and I would not recommend this place.

D1Q38OaLwyh9Y8KVcJTqiA.text: I've had a lot of Pho from different restaurants, but I'm going to remember this place.  We had Pho as breakfast meal before we left Las Vegas.  The Steak and tendon Pho was delicious.  The soup wasn't too heavy and there was a lot of steak and tendon.  I try to finish my noodles at meat at the same time, but I had more then enough meat left over.    The meal was satisfying and I'll probably stop by this place again.

2BcU8HWbHUg5sT-H_zgQow.text: Pho Bosa is absolutely Pho-Bo(sa)- lous! I love this modest Vietnamese eatery located in an unassuming Chinatown strip mall on the right most side abutting a pizza parlour. The conspicuous and bold red signs reading PHO BOSA VIETNAMESE KITCHEN are hard to miss. With ample parking, air conditioning and conspicuous health advertisements, this place is exactly how you would want your pho joint to look like - a little rough on the surface but delicious on the inside.   The service is incredibly fast - it may be helpful to review the extensive menu prior to your visit as to prevent that glazed "I-don't-know-what-to-get" look of a Pho Bosamateur.   My favorites? (1) Cococane!   Can't decide between sugarcane juice and coconut water? This love child born out of the delicious affair of the fresh pressed sugarcane and coconut water is so refreshingly cool and delicious. The pieces of fresh coconut flesh were creamy and ripe. It was my absolute favorite part of the meal - the perfect chill to round out the hot desert trek.  The size of the drink is quite large and sufficient for two people.   (2) Bun Bo Hue (Spicy Beef Noodle Soup)  Round, thick rice noodles, stewed pork shank, tendons, and ginger infused pork blood are served in fragrant and spicy beef and lemongrass infused broth, into which you add fresh herbs and white onions.   Note: I recommend requesting to remove the pork blood - but this is a personal tapreference.  (3) Hay Bun (Vermicelli Noodle Bowl) Feeling less soupy and more crunchy? The varieties of Hay Bun are a great alternative and you can select your choice of protein over vermicelli noodles, bed of lettuce, mint, basil, carrot-daikon mixture, cucumbers, peanuts and green onions.   Pho Bosa, you're the Cococane - Bun Bo Hue Boss...a of Las Vegas!

Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Bo Hue
Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cococane

VWbn-rPJyqXzLtzrKChgzg.text: Not the best pho and not the worst pho I've ever had, but decently portioned with adequate flavor. In Vegas, you can find a lot cheap eats but one thing I have noticed is Vietnamese food isn't that cheap!   My friend and I ordered the combination dac biet pho ($9.50) and egg rolls (cha gio) ($10 with vegetables, $8 sans vegetables) and a Vietnamese iced coffee (ca phe sua da) for $4.50 each. Our total bill came out to be $45 with tax and tip - a little bit on the expensive end, similar to prices you'd pay for pho in the Bay Area, and much higher price for egg rolls than usual!   In terms of flavor, the pho broth was pretty tasty but it was very oily. The egg rolls were okay - but the vegetables that accompanied the egg rolls were old (e.g lettuce had brown spots from not being fresh). The Vietnamese coffee was as you'd expect at any Vietnamese establishment-- except its pretty large and worth the $4.50.  Overall, Pho Bosa is overpriced Vietnamese food with decent flavor. If you want to pay Bay Area prices for your food, then come here! The only bargain that can be had here is their iced coffee...

GYpYZ_coZCX71V-9RDhYtQ.text: I haven't tried their pho yet. This is my 2nd time going here and I've ordered the Bun bo hu each time. Just the right amount of spice before it starts making you need to drink some water. They give generous portions of meat as well in their soup. We also ordered the pork spring rolls, and those were your typical viet spring rolls.

BRyBqLwFnerb0mgtFu3Mmw.text: Awesome place! My family comes here all the time and always say great things and I finally had a chance to try it. Pho Bosa did not disappoint!! It's one of my new favorite Vietnamese restaurants!   One of my favorite dishes ever is com tam, which is a rice plate with meat and a few other things like shredded pork, egg quiche, and shrimp wrapped in tofu skin. Unfortunately, not a lot of places in Vegas make good com tam which is why I am SO glad to have found Pho Bosa! I ordered the grilled pork and really enjoyed it, it almost brought a little tear to my eye LOL. My sister always gets the tofu spring rolls and my mom raves about the banh mi. I usually don't get boba at restaurants but decided to get their green Thai tea and it was amazing. My sister got a taro slush with popping boba and that was great as well.   It seems like everything they make here is incredible and I can go on and on about why you should try it out for yourself! Our server MO was so freaking awesome as well as everyone else here like the guy who refilled our waters and the cashier - they were all so friendly. Can't wait to come back!!

Uk7MXE9J4oWiN56v_SeQ2w.text: Overall I felt the pho here wasn't bad - wasn't super amazing, but it at least filled the craving of a colder day and having something nice and warm. The first sip of the broth confirmed that they knew what they were doing and had a good base to begin with. A few bites in you got to the taste fatigue point - so was nice to add some extras (some additional basil, some extra sprouts, etc) to keep things interesting.  The summer rolls / tofu rolls left something to be desired. Lacked the feeling of freshness you would want to see or experience, but all good. The pho was the highlight. Probably would not drop by too frequently if Las Vegas was my regular stomping ground, but if I was in need of a pho fix. This place does just fine.

Uf8ygp-4dJBK1ldJ9U9wgg.text: Very unimpressed. The menu is horrible with the small font and the inaccurate information. I ordered a rice plate and was missing some items that were listed on the menu and the server said it's a typo and that i have to order the missing item additionally. Also the fish sauce that comes with the rice and noodle dish is a joke. It's literally just bottled fish sauce and they tell you to mix it with the red chili garlic sauce (the one with the green cap sold at Asian stores) to make your fish sauce. See my picture for yourself to see. Service was also horrible. No water refills and no return after delivering food to see how everything is. The food itself wasn't that good. Will not be coming back or recommending to others.

qpVPHdnXdc0ERqcSiBSB5g.text: Pho Bosa appears quite popular on Yelp so we decided to come here on a cold winter night for some hot, soupy noodles.  The restaurant was quite busy on this Sunday evening. I believe the steamy pho broth really hit the spot for many. The vermicelli shrimp crab soup was really unique unlike any other I have tasted and extremely flavorful. My "bun" - rice vermicelli with grilled pork and egg rolls was also super-yummy and texturally delightful. I really enjoyed the  combination of fresh vegetables and the aromatic grilled meats, rich egg rolls and flavorful fish sauce.   In addition to the dishes, they also serve a variety of specialty drinks such as milk teas and fruit snow drinks. I was so excited to see that they serve sugarcane juice but it was rather tasteless and not at all sweet or "sugarcane-like". Perhaps it was not the right season for it or I just got a bum sugarcane.

Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho
Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruity snow drink

gpdQ73Ya0mSrE9xk7ZfLdw.text: I think Vegas has the best food off strip and for some reason, there is always the amazing Pho place in a weird strip mall that you would just drive right by. (And drive right by we did. The lyft driver missed the entrance to the strip mall twice.)  We got there and as we opened the door saw so many vietnamese people inside and we got super excited! There were many specials that were off menu and for a sucker for specials I knew I had to get it. There was a sign for oxtail pho and fresh sugar cane juice, so I got oxtail pho and sugar cane juice.   The sugar cane juice was so fresh and sweet with just a touch of pulp. Perfect way to cool down in the Las Vegas heat. It was quite a large portion (think starbucks grande and then a little bit taller) for the price, I thought it was pretty good value.   The famous oxtail pho, now as I read other reviews, I asked beforehand how much it would be as it was kind of mixed. The server told me it was $17.99 and that's how much it showed up as in the bill. Just for your own peace of mind, ask them in case it shows up as something else on your bill. The oxtail was cooked so tender and had this smokey flavour that was so surprising. I've never had an oxtail pho quite like this! There was a very generous amount of oxtail and it was a larger bowl than normal so you could share this between 2 people and order some appitizers. Definitely recommend it was super delicious!  We also got a fresh roll with sausage(?) It was sooooo good! There was a tiny crunchy spring roll thing in the middle to give it a good crunch and toasty flavour! Was super delicious definitely recommend.  Tldr; if you feinding for some specialty pho this is the place to go! Although their regular soups were pretty tasty as well

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sugar cane juice
Photo of Pho Bosa - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho

pUWg7vtZgN-KBvM3ilJUuQ.text: Decided to take a gamble by going to a new pho place away from "chinatown" vicinity, and the adventurous gesture paid  off with 5 happy campers.    Bun Bo Hue: very hearty, but could use a bit more lemongrass.  meat was properly marinated.  My sis make a bomb BBH, so not that many places will stack up to hers.  i can honestly attest that this was pretty good.  pho: where do you begin?  such generous portions of meat, mountains of pho noodles, and very meaty broth. the toddler slurped his bowl as if he just ran a 2K marathon.  the item that's worth writing to Mommy and Aunt's & Uncles about is... drum roll please... smoked short rib pho.  it truly is worth the $17.99 price tag.  so much flavor packed in a bowl.  i wouldn't even call it a bowl, i'd say you got a baby bathtub of pho.  LOL. calling it huge or gigantic is still an understatement.  i mean, where can you get a bowl that big? the smokiness of the meat did not seep into the broth and cause and unsavory bitterness.  it was just perfect.  Next time i'm in Sin City, this would be the place i'd frequent again.  Decor not too trendy, but happy workers with genuine smiles, and soul-filling food makes up for decor.

iSzvTWOoJQfV-M8Svnam-g.text: Came here with my family as soon as I landed and Las Vegas. My parents had previously came here on there last trip and they absolutely loved it. I forgot the exact name of what I got but I can tell you what it came with and not my surprise it was a lot! It had rice, meat (with bone), fried tofu, soup, and some veggies. My family all ordered the same thing since it was so yummy. We also tried their sugar cane juice and it's really good just like in Vietnam. I definitely recommend coming here, not only was the food great but the service was too! Our waiter was friendly and not to mention really funny. Overall experience was best for a first timer that just got off the plane and was super hungry!

VQFenvNuzym_pxFGZKrHUA.text: The OMG BEST EVER Oxtail Pho you'll find anywhere!!   Thanks to Yelp... we found Pho Bosa!!!  We came for Bun Bo Hue... then saw the Oxtail special and decided to try it.  The signage indicated "Blacked Smokey Oxtail Pho" ... just sounded too good to pass up!  We didn't ask for prices and it turned out up be $18.99 for each bowl....  a bit pricey at a glance but it was totally worth it.  OMG .. it is the best tasty perfectly seasoned oxtail that you'll ever have!!!!!    Honestly, the soup is a tad salty but it's fine.  The pho is cooked perfectly and noodles didn't clump.  We slurped up every bit of pho and ate up every last piece of piece on that oxtail bone... mmm.'mmmmmzmzzmmm  ... yum!!!  What I also appreciate their pho the most is the hot soup.  The soup stayed piping hot the whole time during our meal even during this cold weather.  I so appreciate that!!   The other highlight is the fresh spring roll with pork sausage.  Honestly it is one of the BEST spring roll i've ever had.  And, their special peanut sauce... you can just slurp that all up!!   The fresh spring roll was this perfect blend of warm sausage + cool lettuce + room temperature peanut sauce.  Inside was a perfect balance of pork sausage (perfectly seasoned)+ crispy wonton + crunchy lettuce + warm spring roll skin.  OH SOOOO GOOOOOODDDD!!!!!  Overalll an awesome experience with excellent food!!  Love this place!!!!!  Thanks Yelp!

8CGEHTQqf4LlgdPzaFb-hg.text: This felt like where all the locals came in to eat. We started with a very refreshing fresh sugarcane juice. It was pricy at $6 a cup but I felt it was worth the price. Then we ordered 2 different Pho and a beef short rib over rice dish which was made into a combo with egg, shrimp cake and an egg roll. The short rib was on the chewy side, the shrimp cake was greasy. The Pho broth was amazing- each sip tasted like the broth was brewed for hours. We were there about 2 in the afternoon and the place was pretty packed then. I would recommend this place if you are a Pho lover. I haven't had this amazing broth for a while now.

PEZ6JRPk7uaGQRWknHCEkQ.text: Amazing banh mi! I don't normally write such a stellar review after only one visit to a restaurant, but I haven't been able to get the char siu banh mi sandwich from Pho Bosa out of my mind. It was one of the best banh mi I've ever had, and I have those sandwiches all the time at home in DC. The combination of Chinese pork and picked veggies and garlic mayo on a perfect roll was heavenly. Washed it down with a bubble tea. I can't wait to come back and get this again and try other items on their menu. Tucked away in a strip mall off the strip and a bit away from Chinatown, Pho Bosa is truly a hidden gem.

E-NIgWGf_u3cgYZsUdhU2g.text: Arrived here around noon on a Monday and was seated fairly quickly. Business does pick up during lunch time (so expect a waitlist). Service was very nice, they started us with water right away.  Started off with their "Sugar Cane Juice" which was amazing (7/10). Very sweet and has a slight lemon flavor to it. Got their Pho "Combination Beef Noodle Soup" which was pretty good (7/10). Broth was very good and their meat portion was just enough for a quick fix.

rp37Vl3LW-N4Ud3oH8c4mw.text: I've been to Pho Bosa 3 times, and even went twice in one week. Even after the years have gone by, Pho Bosa has consistently delivered amazing bowls of pho.  Though their pho broth is amazing, I'm equally happy that they serve nem nuong + nuoc mia. Very hard to resist coming here whenever I'm in Vegas!

qsfD25Q2q1DSVlEdxgllUA.text: The restaurant's location was off the 15 freeway on west spring mountain it's very close. The exterior was very dark and you cant see the restaurant from the outside bec. of the dark tinted windows. It was located in a peculiar looking business establishment with offices around it.   The food was good plain and simple. We ordered the spring rolls which was freshly made by them unlike other restaurants that serves you frozen spring roll.   We also ordered the beef and pork toppings with rice served with pickles which was good for our sweet and spicy taste buds.   The last item we ordered was the clear soup with shredded beef and balls. This was probably one of their specialty soups in the restaurant and it was worth it.   The price was around 10 bucks for the soup and 9 bucks for the beef and pork toppings with rice.    Service was what you expect in a small Asian restaurant very passive. The inside was clean and service was quick.

7WWHjjdolgIxzaBMeMQvRA.text: Im from bolsa california and i tried the food here. Theres too much MSG in the Pho and the springrolls were microwaved. Food was very poor in taste and quality

7jA0gdpeLGrJbHi01COiHw.text: My favorite pho place in the WORLD!! It's a little grimy in there (especially in the summer), and service could be a little more attentive, but whatever this place deserves the whole 5 stars for how goddamn delicious their pho is. you can taste the msg and feel the oil come out of your pores. Yum. if you're ever hungover after heavy night of drinking, I highly recommend you dine at pho bosa.

JOpNgsFSwGFh2DKbZU0N3A.text: Best nem nuong in town! Also, great bun rieu noodle and bun bo. Tried their oxtail soup for the first time. It was ok, not as great as I had expected.
